intro: Phialodiscus laurentii, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces cup-shaped seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. The botanical features of Phialodiscus laurentii make it a distinctive and valuable addition to native plant gardens.
